oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Logarithmic corrected Polynomial $f(R)$ inflation mimicking a cosmological constant
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sadeghi, J.
Pourhassan, B.
Kubeka, A. S.
Rostami, M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: General Relativity and Quantum Cosmology
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this paper, we consider an inflationary model of $f(R)$ gravity with polynomial form plus logarithmic term. We calculate some cosmological parameters and compare our results with the Plank 2015 data. We find that presence of both logarithmic and polynomial corrections are necessary to yield slow-roll condition. Also, we study critical points and stability of the model to find that it is a viable model.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: International Journal of Modern Physics D 25 (2016) 1650077
